title: Heavy showers above 100 mm expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says rainy condition is expected to continue further for the next 24 hours in Northern, North-central, Eastern, Uva and Central provinces.

title: 14 injured as bus topples in Serunuwara
byline: A private passenger bus travelling from Kattankudy to Colombo has reportedly been involved in an accident this morning (20) near the bend in front of the Kallar army camp in the Serunuwara area on the Serunuwara-Kantale road, within the Serunuwara Police Division.

title: Fire burns through multiple tents at Hindu festival in India but causes no injuries
byline: A fire tore through at least 18 temporary tents at a massive Hindu festival thronged by millions of people in India’s northern Prayagraj city, officials said Sunday. There were no injuries.

title: TikTok restores service for US users based on Trump’s promised executive order
byline: TikTok restored service to users in the United States on Sunday just hours after the popular video-sharing platform went dark in response to a federal ban, which President-elect Donald Trump said he would try to pause by executive order on his first day in office.

title: Census of low-income families for second phase of ‘Aswesuma’ to begin tomorrow
byline: The Welfare Benefits Board says that the census of low-income families who have applied for the second phase of the “Aswesuma” welfare benefits programme will commence tomorrow (21).

title: Israel frees 90 Palestinian prisoners as ceasefire takes hold after Hamas returns 3 Israeli hostages
byline: The first three hostages were released from Gaza and the first Palestinian prisoners were freed from Israeli custody as the fragile ceasefire between Israel and Hamas took hold following 15 months of war, with mixed emotions and more difficult steps ahead over the next six weeks.

title: Sri Lanka welcomes Gaza ceasefire agreement
byline: Sri Lanka has welcomed the recent ceasefire agreement in Gaza, which has brought an end to the 15-month long conflict between Israel and Hamas.

title: Mahinda will have to pay Rs 4.6M rent or vacate Colombo residence – President AKD
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has reiterated his commitment to completely eliminating the corrupt politics in the country, as promised to the people.

title: Sri Lanka’s economic sectors gear up for further growth in early 2025
byline: Sri Lanka’s Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) for December 2024 recorded growth in both manufacturing and services sectors.

title: CBSL to launch new investment tranche with advanced strategies, prioritizing foreign reserves
byline: With projections indicating historically high levels of inflows from the services trade and workers’ remittances, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) plans to capitalize on market opportunities through diversified strategies across various markets.

title: UK tea experts explore trading opportunities with Sri Lankan specialty tea producers
byline: A delegation of experts and specialists from the UK tea industry is in Sri Lanka this week to strengthen connections with the country’s specialty tea producers and explore business opportunities.

title: Instagram rolls out TikTok-like features amid uncertainty about rival’s future
byline: Instagram has rolled out a number of updates in recent days that appear to be aimed at attracting TikTok users while the short-video app’s future remains in limbo.

title: Get ready for world’s first trillionaires: Musk, Bezos and Zuckerberg to cross the line first
byline: Move over billionaires. The first trillionaires are on their way.

title: Trump to sign ‘close to 100 executive orders’ - as he is set to become 47th US president
byline: Donald Trump will become the 47th president of the United States today - marking an astonishing return to the White House for the businessman and former reality TV star.

title: No further rice shortages, President assures
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake assured that the government has implemented measures to ensure that there will be no shortage of rice during the upcoming ‘Maha’ cultivation season.

title: Ex-minister Manusha prepared to give statement to CID - court told
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara’s attorney has informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court that he is prepared to provide a statement to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) tomorrow (21) regarding the matter of providing job opportunities for Sri Lankans in South Korea, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: CID launches probe into alleged online train tickets racket
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has reported to the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (20) that it has initiated an investigation into an alleged major racket involving ‘e-Tickets’ sold for up-country trains including to Ella.

title: Gal Oya river bunds breach in Nena Kaadu
byline: The bunds of Gal Oya river have been breached in the Nena Kaadu area in Ampara.

title: Former Minister Vijith Wijayamuni Soysa granted bail
byline: Former Minister Vijith Wijayamuni Soysa, who was arrested by the Walana Anti-Vice Unit over an illegally assembled lorry, has been granted bail by the Bandarawela Magistrate’s Court, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Two Sri Lankans nabbed with ‘Kush’ worth over Rs. 60M at BIA
byline: Two Sri Lankan nationals have been detained by the Airport Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) upon their arrival at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for the possession of a stock of ‘Kush’ cannabis.

title: Decision on reopening schools in Eastern and North Central provinces
byline: All government schools in the Eastern Province which had remained closed today (20) due to adverse weather conditions will reopen tomorrow (21), the provincial education authorities said.

title: Firearm discovered at construction site in Borella
byline: Borella Police have launched an investigation following the discovery of a foreign-made 9mm pistol in the Castle Road area on the evening of January 18, 2025.

title: Minister criticizes lack of commitment to address port congestion
byline: Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports, and Civil Aviation Bimal Ratnayake has expressed dissatisfaction with the lack of coordinated efforts to alleviate congestion at the Colombo Port, despite clear instructions from the President to address the issue promptly.

title: Schools in North Central Province reopen tomorrow
byline: All government schools in the North Central Province which had remained closed today (20) due to adverse weather conditions will also reopen tomorrow (21), the provincial education authorities said.

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa is ready to vacate Colombo residence at any time – Namal
byline: The son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian, Namal Rajapaksa says his father is prepared to vacate the official residence in Colombo, if required.

title: Express train engine catches fire; services disrupted on several lines
byline: The engine of the express train plying from Beliatta to Kandy has reportedly caught fire while on the move, this evening (20).

title: UNP agrees to talks with SJB on uniting for upcoming elections
byline: The Working Committee of the United National Party (UNP) has reportedly approved initiating discussions with the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) on the possibility of the two parties collaborating in the upcoming elections.

title: 55 reservoirs overflow across Sri Lanka; 60 tanks exceed capasity
byline: The Irrigation Department reports that persistent heavy rainfall across Sri Lanka has caused most of the major and medium-sized reservoirs under its management to overflow.
